website_summaries.verdict: An affordable Hoover vacuum in a stick model that's lightweight and easy to maneuver yet offers impressive cleaning power.
pros: Sports a slim design that makes it easy to use, reach tight spaces, and store
Practical to use on carpet and hard flooring
Powered by battery, so there's no cord to get in the way of accomplishing your chores
cons: A little sluggish on thick-pile carpet
The downside of the battery is that it only runs about 30 minutes before it needs recharging

website_summaries.verdict: Cordless, lightweight design gives you the quality of a Hoover at a fraction of the cost.
pros: Electronic brush roll is good for carpet and hardwood
Cordless design makes it easy to use anywhere in the house
Slim design makes it easy to store
Extreme recline handle allows you to get underneath furniture without moving it
cons: The battery lasts around 30 minutes, so it's not great for cleaning a big house at one time

website_summaries.verdict: Newer and lighter version of a much-loved model.
pros: Designed for daily use to transition between types of flooring
The electronic brushroll picks up debris on carpets as well as hard floors
Sleek, low-profile design easily maneuvers around and under furniture
Controls and battery gauge are at your fingertips
At 7.3 pounds, it is a lightweight option
cons: Not bagless, which is inconvenient for some users

customer_reviews.title: I’d Say It Sucks, But That Would Be A Lie.
customer_reviews.text: This sucks...because it doesn’t suck. It worked well for a couple of weeks, but now it doesn’t pick anything up. Or it picks it up, but then shoots it right back out again. Horrible with edges and very weak suction. Very disappointed I missed the return window on this!
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Battery is garbage!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this vacuum was amazing. Originally I could vacuum my whole house on one battery charge. But after 2 months of use I can barely vacuum one room. The battery doesn’t even fully charge anymore! Don’t waste your money on this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L. Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: What did Hoover do???
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely loved our BH50010 Hoover Linx but unfortunately it died after many years of use. We were so impressed by this little stick vac that we purchased one for my parents, my wife's parents, and my sister. We also purchased other Hoover products based on our delight with the Linx. Anyway, I immediately purchased the BH50020PC to replace the old one. It looks exactly like the old one, but unfortunately it's louder (and unconfidently moans when it runs), feels much cheaper, and most importantly FAR LESS POWERFUL. Why would Hoover mess with success?? My advice is to stay away from the BH50020PC. Very disappointed loyal Hoover buyer here.
customer_reviews.author: Rob. B

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be....
customer_reviews.text: We have owned one of these for years and have loved it. Since it has been damaged over the years and held together with gusset plates and screws we decided to start fresh and get a new one, retiring the old one to upstairs for quick cleanup. To our surprise, the product has not improved over the years and has declined in capability. The new one is now upstairs and the old one is back doing kitchen cleanup with the quality we had expected from the new one. Maybe I can use the new one for parts on the old one?
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Lost suction after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked amazing on our tile floors for a few days and now will only suction occasionally. Canister does not want to stay in place either. We have followed cleaning and care instructions and still have problems with it working. This vacuum was recommended to me by a friend and I had high hopes. I'm very disappointed with mine; hoping maybe I have a defective one and the company will help resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not like my previous orders.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work like the previous orders (6)-3 for me and 3 for someone else, because they were great. I f this is an improvement, they better go back to the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Cami

customer_reviews.title: A wonderfully convenient vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a slightly earlier model for a couple of years. We decided to replace it only because we managed to wear it out. It's a great vacuum, good battery life and extremely convenient. Eventually we managed to break the handle fastening on our old one. Also, parts of the cyclone became loose. I attribute these eventual failures to carelessness. A word to the wise: If you let go of the handle while it is not upright and latched you may damage the handle when it falls to the floor. These vacuums are sturdy but not indestructible. The fact that we are buying the latest model is evidence of how much we love this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Pete K

customer_reviews.title: Great sucking power
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stick vac. Not too heavy. Cleaned my 1400 sq foot house like a dream. I had no idea how dirty my house was until I used it. They made my rugs look like new (like I washed and fluffed them). Even my husband went wow and took a picture of the rug (wish I took a before and after). Battery life is great. It has no crevice tools (so I use another hand vac for those hard to reach places), but otherwise I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: V. Tang

customer_reviews.title: Good vac for quick pick up around the house.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to vacuum the whole house with this, but this is a great little work horse for quick pick up in one or two rooms depending on size. Love it for quick pickup in kitchen and bathroom especially. Small size works so well in small spaces. Suction is very good though your time on battery is limited. Especially love the ease of emptying canister and washing unit when done. Works well on flatter area rugs. I purchased a second battery but that was very disappointing. Would not hold a charge. I would buy this item again and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my eye on these for years. I finally bought one. I wish i had sooner. A linx vacuum is the perfect solution to everyday floor maintenance. When paired with a more powerful vacuum for once every 2 weeks deep cleaning, you have a complete system. The beauty of the Linx is how easy and convenient it is to use on a daily basis. Instead of dragging out the big boy vacuum every time you need to vacuum ,you simply grab the Linx and walk around the house quickly cleaning carpet or hard floors as you go. Its powerful enough to do a great job of the basic cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Impressed

customer_reviews.title: No promises on when this will happen and if it is like their response so far I will not depend on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is totally unexceptable it only worked a couple of times and now will not come on. I have spent hours with Hoover Support and they believe it is the battery. I had to return it at my expense and they say they will send a new battery. No promises on when this will happen and if it is like their response so far I will not depend on a quick response. I should have returned it to amazon as it was within the 60 days. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great “CORDLESS” vacuum- it’s a very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have a black lab & she sheds like crazy so I need to vacuum daily . I was using another well known brand but they never lasted long enough. I have a plug in vacuum but it’s so much easier with a cordless. This item is perfect for my needs . It’s easy to use , the suction is very good. I use both on my hardwood floors as well as my area rugs . It’s light weight but not flimsy. I am a person who loves a clean house and this vacuum is so easy for me . I highly recommend it . The price is very reasonable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and good suction
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this sweeper for my tiled floors and my garage that has a epoxy coating on the floor. It has enough suction to pick up everything and in my garage, I have low pile runners that it cleans perfectly. I have one large area rug in the living room that is low pile and it cleans it perfectly as well. It has enough battery power for cleaning two or three rooms including my two car garage with no problem. I am disabled, and this is light enough that I can clean with ease and I have some steps that are carpeted that it cleans really well. Overall this is a very good vacuum at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless
customer_reviews.text: I have mostly hardwood floors, plus some carpet and some linoleum. I read reviews that said it did all of these well. It doesn't. Possibly the first couple of times it did a good, even great job. Now it does very little but just enough to require that I clean it so yes, it does pick up some stuff. But most of it gets sucked up and spat right out. It does it's best job on carpet but even then, not good enough. I know I can't return it as the time for that has passed. I will just kiss the money goodbye, throw it in the trash and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: tahseen paulson

customer_reviews.title: Second Time Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum works great on tile and hard wood floors, but just stopped working. This is the 2nd one that has done this. We thought the first time it was just a fluke. Today the second one stopped. Motor starts skipping and shuts on and off and then just stops working period. Short circuiting in the wiring. Not a battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: Carol H

customer_reviews.title: Used to be quality vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased at least six of these Hoover Linx Cordless vacs, for different places and for gifts. They used to be the bomb. The one I bought about 15 months ago is now junk. The dust box falls off constantly. The suction sucks, oh ha ha. It won't even pick up a bit of cat litter anymore. I am very disappointed in what was once the only vacuum I ever needed. On to another brand. WHY does the quality drop on these things after so much popularity? Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Lalo

customer_reviews.title: Warning: NO Suction, not good on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased for light cleaning, as I typically use a whole home vacuum. This product was used approximately once a week, to clean crumbs from our hardwood floor. After barely 6 months of light usage it is completely unusable. There is no suction and the machine simply pushes the dirt around the floor. I had high hopes for this product, but have been utterly disappointed. As a first time Hoover purchaser, I won’t make this mistake again. It’s unfortunate the return window was so short, or I would definitely be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Tunedlgt

customer_reviews.title: Head sweeper  don’t stay flats on floor
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product before [3yrs]( heavy every day use)and it held up very well till the filter vortex Broke. The new purchase didn’t seem give good Suction and the head sweeper don’t seem wont to stay down flat on ground. It stays Slightly tilted up. I basically replaced the vortex part on the old model and that baby still rolling strong!
customer_reviews.author: moejama

customer_reviews.title: Great for hardwood and low-pile throw rugs
customer_reviews.text: THIS vacuum is amazing on hardwood floors and low-pile throw rugs! I vacuumed ~900 sq ft on a single charge and had 2/3 the battery power remaining. It picked up kitty litter in the mud room, loose puppy food in the dining room, and dirt/fuzz/pet hair on all my throw rugs around the house. It’s lightweight, easy to maneuver, and has great suction power (but not so much that it slings kitty litter around). Love it!
customer_reviews.author: chiquitita230

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Elderly
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is a bit flimsy for the price, but I've become seriously arthritic and its light weight is a boon since I have stairs to deal with. It does a good job on both carpeting and bare floors (if only lightly soiled). I like that it doesn't suck up the edges of area rugs. The collection cylinder is tiny, but sufficient for my needs and easy to empty and replace. I bought an extra battery... invaluable for swapping out when the one in use runs down (every few days). I'd get something heavier and with a HIPPA filter if I had a pet.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Love this vacuum...
customer_reviews.text: Well now that they replaced the one that quit - amazing customer service - opened first one charged battery and used it for about a month - small place but the battery needed charging so charged when put back in vacuum would not work, figured it was the battery so ordered a 2nd one - wanted a spare anyway - new battery did not work either....Called Hoover Customer Service and what a pleasant experience. Handled very efficiently and they replaced and within a few days had a new one - works great and so far no problems, will update if it fails again, but I cannot say enough good for how the replacement was handled....
customer_reviews.author: Capt Jim

customer_reviews.title: Only usable for 2 years 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I used this little vacuum often to pick up crumbs and dog hair It did a very good job However - It is no longer any good. The charger quit working and it costs approximately $100 to replace the charger for a $110.00 item. I first replaced the $40.00 battery, then when it would not recharge realized it was the charger. I resent parts being that expensive and not working more than a little over 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Electrolux Ergorapido that I loved that died after 5 years. The Hoover has much better suction and the only thing that the Electrolux did better was a wider range of rotation on the head and the removable built-in handheld was very convenient. The Hoover does a good job on my tile and shorter pile area rugs. On my two very thick rugs, it doesn't do a great job, although neither does my heavier duty plug in upright vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: DaveSFL

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Cordless Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I have another vacuum of this model, which I purchased from Costco a few years ago. It's been working very well, but when my daughter needed a vacuum for her new apartment, I thought I should look into different brand. All the other cordless vacuum such as Dyson or Shark seem to be heavy on top, which makes hard to maneuver. I tried one of those and returned it and bought this Hoover Linx instead. This vacuum is very light and has a good suction power. It doesn't replace regular upright vacuums, but it is so much easier to use and it definitely is great for a hard floor. My daughter loves it and that's all that matters!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina K.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and efficient suction
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for floors and carpets. The dust container seems to fill up quite quickly, but that is proof that it is working really well! It takes a bit of effort to empty and clean the unit. It is worth routinely keeping the brush clean too. The clip to hold the dust container is a bit short, so it sometimes unclips after cleaning. The power does run out quite quickly, but it is strong while it lasts. Recharge takes a couple of hours. The unit is lightweight and easy to use, and being cordless makes a huge difference in terms of simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Road tripping

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT worth the 4 stars it gets
customer_reviews.text: I was so surprised how much I hated this vacuum when it came. The reviews suggested it would be above average, but as far as I can tell, it's well below average in every way. It has terrible suction. Better to say it pulverizes things and then spits them out the front. It is hard to maneuver and has little or no swivel capability. It's LOUD and makes a grinding noise when you try to use the brush feature. The whole battery charging setup is strange. Why make it so you have to pull the battery out of the machine to charge it...that seems so "1980s". Parting words...Keep shopping for a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Quale

customer_reviews.title: Older model much better, new one is a waste
customer_reviews.text: I bought y original Lynx in 2012. I liked it so much I wanted a second for upstairs so I'd have one in both locations. However, the new one is not built as well. The nose wont stay down. We had to take a small dumbbell to the front to keep it down while vacuuming so it will stay down. It is so frustrating to use, I only use my old one now. We use the new model's battery for the old vacuum. So far that all it has really been good for, parts.
customer_reviews.author: MintyFreshMomma

customer_reviews.title: HOOVER “WARRANTY” IS A SHAM. Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Used LINX daily for 6 YEARS. New LINX stopped working after 6 DAYS. Contacted Hoover per instructions. Did troubleshooting. Stopped working after 2 more days. “Replacement” provided by Hoover was downgraded/cheaper model. Hoover insisted it could supply a “comparable unit” in accord with warranty and refused to provide $20 difference in purchase price. Contacted Amazon support which agreed with my analysis and credited $20 to my Amazon account.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Reis

customer_reviews.title: Great and Powerful Vacuum With Small Dirt Cup
customer_reviews.text: Portability, battery life, suction power, all fantastic. We have 3 dogs, but you wouldn't know it from looking at the floors; it's great for hair. After comparing many products, I couldn't be happier with this vacuum. Even "renewed", it's like new. The *only* drawback is that the dirt cup is small, so it has to be emptied more often. We don't have stairs, but I don't think it'd be ideal for that, given that there's no, what do you call it?, extendable arm, or detatchable hand-vac.
customer_reviews.author: A. DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Buy the additional battery but with it, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 93 yr old mother. I like that it has no cord for her to trip over or try to wind up at the end. She can quickly grab it and clean up an area without any trouble. You absolutely have to buy a 2nd battery since the battery life is about 10 minutes. Her small apt can be done in about that but if you are going any longer, you need to switch out the battery which I did buy and put the discharged one into the charger while you finish the job. It is light weight which is another plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but LED charging light stays on with the battery removed...
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent cordless stick vacuum. Works fairly well, just a few gripes. *The blue LED charging light stays on even after the battery is removed. The only way to turn that off is to unplug the charging dock from the wall. Defective Unit....Anyone else have this issue? *It will pick up larger items that get lodged, specifically plastic water bottle caps, it's very difficult to remove these items....so be careful about clogs. *This is strictly for floors and carpet, no way to clean anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS VACUUM! YOUR BACK WILL THANK YOU
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this vacuum cleaner. The ease of size and weight has made it a joy to vacuum. I used to procrastinate due to having to lug my vacuum up/and down 2 flights of stairs, now I use daily on the high traffic carpet regions and my entire hardwood main floor. I have three boys (two under three years of age), and there is always dirt/crumbs/etc. I have not had any issue with the battery life. This product has completely met, and exceeded, my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Shanda McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Wow this thing is Garbage
customer_reviews.text: My Friend recommended it to me, and I wanted it to work so bad, but this thing is garbage. Not just a little garbage, like Ive had it a few months, everyone has looked it and, and it just does not work. I mean you can get it if you want to spend 2 hours attempting to vaccum a living room, only to have to go over it with a friggin broom to get it to look halfway decent. Seriously, if you want something that actually works as a vaccum, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: so lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light weight vacuum and I got it. It has good suction power. It does not leave the smoothest surface on my carpet but I love it any way because vacuuming is no longer a chore. I vacuum every day with this vacuum. And it's cordless so I am not vacuuming over the cord. I am glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for homes with pet hair + hardwood/laminate flooring
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of looking and reading reviews before I finally chose this stick vacuum. I was buying this for quick vacuuming of pet hair on hard surfaces. It picks up very well, is fairly lightweight and is cordless so it is very convenient to use. I do wish it got a little flatter to get under furniture and the reason I'm taking a star from it is because I wish the battery lasted longer. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tiddywagon

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit!
customer_reviews.text: Mostly used for tile, stone and wood floors and occasional area rugs. Works great and this model has noticeably better suction than the non signature version. Buy an extra battery though so that you always have one ready to go. Not so great on deep shags but thats not what i bought it for. Easy to empty out dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Cblow5

customer_reviews.title: What a GREAT little vacumn
customer_reviews.text: We bought our 1st Link vacuum 8 years ago and it ran like a champ until I used it the garage and forgot it was there. Unfortunately when I backed out of the garage the next time, I ran over it. I don't think running over it with my SUV was in the list of things i could do with it. I ordered another immediately. This is the best darn vacuum we've ever had. OK so a great big vacuum might be nicer for real deep cleaning, but for the everyday, pick up the mess in a hurry. you just can't beat this one. Mike and Flo Smith
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Vacuums!
customer_reviews.text: The Linx series from Hoover are great little vacuums. Great suction and sturdy. My only disappointment is that it seems they don't make the handheld version anymore. It was great too! We operate a staging company and use these vacuums to clean up after every job. This is our third one. The previous two still work with no issues. They've cleaned hundreds of homes and as we grow, so does our vacuum collection. For us, a vacuum has to have great suction, be durable, light, with no flimsy parts attached and are reasonably priced. They get abused daily and we love using them.
customer_reviews.author: Shelman

customer_reviews.title: This is the best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing since sliced bread! I keep it tucked away in the corner of the kitchen and I use several times a day! Goes from carpet to floor with one easy flip of the switch. Has enough juice to clean the throw rugs but doesn't (typically) suck them up. The dirt canister is easy to empty and you can actually wash it (if you accidently suck up grated asiago cheese from the kitchen floor and make it smell bad like I did). The battery slips in and out of the vacuum and charger and lasts quite a long time. Got one for my sister and my niece too. They both love theirs too. HIGHLY recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: The Epitome of Convenience
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is amazing. It's always there: whether I need it at a moment's notice to clean up a mess on the floor, or have to vacuum the carpeted stairs (which used to be a royal pain in the neck), all I have to do is grab this thing out of the corner and go. I just pluck the power pack out of its charger and insert it into the machine. There's no cord to mess with, the vacuum is lightweight and handy, and yet it's robust enough to do a whole floor with ease. I'm so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: The Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in two years. The first one stopped working after 6 months of light use. The second one is now also having issues after only a few months of light use. They want me to jump through hoops and drive 120 miles round trip to a service center where they may or may not be able to fix it. I'm done with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jakebullett

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small vac so I didn't have to drag out the central vacuum every time I just wanted to "sweep" up the kitchen and family room. I have 2 dogs and it works great for hair and the dirt they sometimes drag in. I love that its cordless, lightweight and so easy to use. I looked at getting a robot vacuum and some more expensive smaller vacuums and this was SO much less expensive and works great! If I have one negative to say it would be that it could be better along baseboards and corners, but for my purposes it works good enough. I am very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M.C. Denneen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight with great suction!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cordless vacuum! Purchased it after having new Cali Bamboo floors installed and ditching the carpet. It really picks up small stuff off the floor with one swipe. It's very light and I use it many times a day without even thinking that vacuuming is a chore. The battery life is adequate for the area I need to clean (single family, one-story home). I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: anthony shuga

customer_reviews.title: 6 month review
customer_reviews.text: have used it most days for 6 months for spot cleaning.....no heavy duty usage. a week ago i noticed the canister was not filling with dirt and debris. removed the "head" and used some barb wire to clean out the tube that sends the dirt/debris into the canister. the tube was plugged tight with hair from my pup. after cleaning the tube it works just as it did on day one. a piece of heavy duty wire with the end hooked will work well. i really like this unit. it just needs the tube cleaned when the suction isn't pulling debris into canister.
customer_reviews.author: JDonley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Quick Jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cleaner. The first one lasted probably 8 years before it stopped charging, and a new vacuum was just a cheap as a new battery and charger. I have cats and hardwood floors. I use this for quick pick-up of kitty litter and dust bunnies. It's light, easy to empty, and small enough to get into tight spaces. I do not use it for whole house vacuuming, as the suction is good, but not as powerful as a corded model. I love mine and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nestworthy

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum really sucks in a good way
customer_reviews.text: This is freaking amazing! I’ve bought a second one as a back up. I bought two extra lithium batteries and chargers. Once you use the carpet power it drains the battery fairly quickly but if using the floor power, you can get more vacuuming accomplished. I always have 2 batteries charging. I love this easy to handle, lightweight machine. I gave all of my other battery operated vacuum cleaners away, including a Shark as it just didn’t have the power this does.
customer_reviews.author: Denny S. Coats

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this Hoover
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on hardwood floors, particularly on the edges. It also does pretty well on rugs but is not a substitute for a good corded vacuum on deeper nap rugs. The charge lasts long enough to get all the hard-to-reach places on 2200 sq ft of hardwood floors and a staircase. Being able to use with or without the agitator is a plus. We now only use our big corded Hoover vacuum for big rugs. Would purchase again but am hopeful that I will not have to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 of these, bought this one for my grandmother because it works so well and is just so easy to use. She had issues using her hand because of arthritis but this is so light and easy to use the can sweep the entire house with it. It has a great battery life and is still rated one of the most powerful cordless vacuums out there. Of course, it's not a Dyson, but it is almost as powerful and $100's less. Love it, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Babcock

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I was almost sure I'd be returning this because it would be a lame-o vacuum. But nope, turns out it's great for daily maintenance of rugs and hard floors. It picks up food crumbs, cat hair, and stray pieces of cat kibble with no problem. Don't expect the exact results you get from a full size vacuum though. But no way I'm wrestling with that thing every day. If you have wall-to-wall carpet anywhere you'll still need the full size vac. Sorry, I haven't paid enough attention to give specifics about how long the battery charge lasts, but it hasn't been a problem or an irritation. I've been using it for almost 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: mad_nesss

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning is now a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I just love this easy to use and lightweight vacuum. I have been using the last model for years at the antique mall for quick cleanups by the front desk and main entryway. So I decided to buy one for me to use at home. It’s great for hardwood floors which I have n also on carpet. It’s easy to store-doesn’t take up much space. The battery charger I keep plugged in in my kitchen on a shelf hidden behind collectibles. It’s small enough for that. I have 2 other vacuums that I hate to use because they are cumbersome n have to deal with the cords. It’s so easy just to grab this vacuum, a real pleasure 😊
customer_reviews.author: Regina C. Italia

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Hoover cordless vac is so convenient and easy to use!! I love it!!! It's only the two of us in our home and we don't have a lot of dirt or lint on the floors. We have carpet, hardwood, and rugs. I can grab the vac and be through in no time!! No cord to plug in and no cord to hold me back. I recommend the Hoover cordless vac highly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lois Young

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily use and busy families.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I am beyond impressed... This is the best little vacuum for daily use. We have a bully breed dog, 3 inside/outside cats, and two teenagers who rarely wipe their feet and it does a great job picking up what they are constantly tracking in. We don’t have carpet only a couple of area rugs and it picks up per hair beautifully on both. I hardly ever pull out my $2k Kirby anymore. I only need it for deep cleanings. The battery life is great. My house is a little over 1400 ft.2 and I can get it all done on one charge. Great vacuum for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The suction is great, lightweight, easy to use. Battery charges in a couple hours, with 45 minute use. I wish the battery lasted longer (but inhave a lot of wood floors and stairs), but you can always purchase a second one. Suction picks up cereal and popcorn kernels with ease, which is awesome compared to my last stick vacuum. I would like if it could get closer to corners and up against the wall better. Works great with dog hair, crumbs, food, sand, etc. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Ebersole

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this vacuum for very long so I can't speak of durability but I have used it almost daily and I'm happy with it on carpet and hardwood floors. It's easy to maneuver, picks up dirt, dog hair (we have 5 dogs so this is a must), and debris nicely. The battery lasts for about 20-30 minutes which is nice. So far, in happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Clogs easily, losing suction
customer_reviews.text: The head is connected to the stick via a too-small tube, which clogs easily; the motor runs, but there is no suction. The head must be removed to get to and unclog the tube, and even then it's difficult to find and remove the clog. Even when not clogged, suction is mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: remazz

customer_reviews.title: Great, convenient vacuum with power
customer_reviews.text: Ive owned this vacuum for a year and I love it. The convenience of not having a cord makes keeping my place clean a lot easier. I have all wood floors and three area rugs there’s plenty of suction power. I’ve had no issues with the vacuum and the battery is still great. Albeit I do take proper care of the Li battery - never run it completely dead and I don’t leave it constantly leave it on the charger. My place is about 1300 sq ft and one charge will usually last enough to do all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Great sweeper
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great. It has a lot of suction and picks up really well. I recommend it for seniors because it is lightweight and it's easy to push/pull back. I can't speak for how it picks up hair because I don't have any animals, nor hard floors because I don't have hardwood floors either. But for carpets it's one great vacuum cleaner. Can clean about 3 rooms before the battery needs to be charged. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design, the dust collection container just falls out when vacuum is bumped
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible vacuum cleaner design. If you bump the front of the vacuum near the "hoover symbol" (by say, vacuuming under a chair, and the leg hits the front of the vacuum)... the dust container will just drop out of the back and onto the floor and the dust will spill out... so you have to stop multiple times when you're vacuuming. DO NOT BUY this vacuum. this is a terrible design flaw . Watch the video and see how easily the back container falls out... found this out when I kept bumping a chair trying to get under it...
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Good for pet hairs
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, better than the shark cordless one. I had the shark twice and it broke down twice. Decided to try this model, lets see how long it lasts. So far it cleans pet hairs really well.
customer_reviews.author: am408898

customer_reviews.title: AVOID Clogs constantly, totally useless
customer_reviews.text: This stick vacuum worked for a few months but now gets clogged every time I use it. I have to dig out everything I’ve just swept up every single time I use it. My husband took it apart to see if there was anything else clogging it. Nothing. It just clogs on the things I’m sweeping up, usually small amounts of pet hair, crumbs, debris tracked into the entry hall. I’m not using it for big messes, just spot cleaning. I am so frustrated. The return window is closed so I’m out the cash for this one and I have to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Calabretta

customer_reviews.title: Always have an extra battery
customer_reviews.text: I definitely have vacuum issues. I kinda own quite a few vacuums. My Hoover stick vacuum charger got lost in our move but this Lynx is great for almost 2200sq Ft of porcelain tiles in which is sweeping is way too difficult. This Lynx saved my back. Obviously the Hoover people understood that I would need a second battery and they gave me a deal since they no longer provide charging plug for the old stick vac.
customer_reviews.author: Cjogradw

customer_reviews.title: Rubber on small roller wheels coming off
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well for 3 months on tile, wood and carpet. However, the rubber on the two small roller wheels is peeling off. Called company and was told that you could not just replace the two small wheels that should pop out easily. Took it to a vacuum repair shop and they told me that it is a common problem and the whole bottom unit must be replaced. Ridiculous. I stuck two think felt pads behind the wheels so it does not scratch wood floors. The company should offer these as replacement parts after they improve the rubber.
customer_reviews.author: golfer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have had one for 1/12 yrs and just got another one , one will go in my motor home. I am disabled and can't handle a regular vacuum but this one is great light weight , no cord and picks up all the dog hair from my gsd. The down fall is you really need to keep it clean, my husband takes it apart every 2mos and gets out any clogging. I also bought an extra battery so there always charged up.
customer_reviews.author: Mikki Pate

customer_reviews.title: How do you get battery out?
customer_reviews.text: Nice vacuum. Only thing is I only got to use it once. I cannot get the battery out of the vacuum which means I cannot use it. For this reason I would never buy it again. I have the booklets I read the instructions, I had other people trying to remove it after reading the instructions. None of us had any luck do you have any suggestions on how we can remove this battery? You can notify me at Mariano Hanlon@hotmail.com. I hope to hear from you real soon. I need this vacuum to work since I have a broken arm. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Hoover Linx about 6 months ago and I’ve had to perform surgery on it only once! I have two dogs that shed year around and after about 2 uses, I check for clogs. When there is absolutely no suction, I unscrew the bottom and clean out the brush compartment (i.e. the surgery reference). I have hardwood floors everywhere except for the bedrooms, switching from suction to brush is helpful but normally I just stay on the brush option for it does not scratch my floors and the suction is better or it just seems that way. For a cordless rechargeable vacuum, this little guy gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Lyd

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy second hand
customer_reviews.text: Loved it the first three times I used it, and now the battery won’t hold a charge. This is the fifth one I have bought and all have been wonderful, as I have given them as gifts. This one I bought because it was not brand new, Amazon said it had a dent and I didn’t care about the dent. It was $75.00. Saved $55.00. I could not find the dent but now the battery will not hold a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M. Atack

customer_reviews.title: Love this vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this almost daily to vacuum carpet and my wood floors (laminate). It is light weight and easy to use. Even my daughter likes to use it to clean.. that is a bonus. Just wish the charge lasted longer. Still glad I have it!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Pymm

customer_reviews.title: amazing vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious of this vacuum at first because it seemed so light, and was battery powered, but let me tell you this thing is fantastic. Battery life is 30 minutes, which is plenty, and it does an incredible job on hard wood and carpet. On my carpet, which seemed clean to begin with, it pulled an entire canister of dust/dirt/hair out of it. I would buy this over an over-priced Dyson any day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Terrible product. Hoover should be sued!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a -1 rating I would. Within 30 days the power switch started to fail. Within 60 days the wiring at the end to power head connection started to fail. Battery life is abysmal. I am a design engineer and this is one of the worst products I've seen in terms of MBTF (mean time between failure) If one hasn't been started already there should be a class action suit brought against Hoover. Instead of $129 it should be $19.99.
customer_reviews.author: customer_advocate

customer_reviews.title: Best Cordless Upright
customer_reviews.text: We tried the Dyson top of the line cordless and this one, Hoover BH50020PC. Between the two, this is easiest as it has wheels which are easier to use, and doesn't have all those unnecessary attachments of the Dyson. One problem is people try vacuuming large or long items which can clog the internal tube. But you can carefully flush out the debris buildup with water. If it doesn't seem like it's working, check for a clog!
customer_reviews.author: Will B Me

customer_reviews.title: The Best "daily" vacuum ever!
customer_reviews.text: After years of big heavy vacuums that are a workout to get out, and years of lightweight ones with limited suction and cordless ones whose battery dies within 10 minutes, THIS ONE REALLY GOES THE DISTANCE! Heavy enough to do the job yet easy to haul around; great suction and battery just keeps going! If you want a vacuum that will inspire you to get those floors clean every day, you must try this one out!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Clan

customer_reviews.title: A cordless that actually works.
customer_reviews.text: This one was worth the money! Being freed up from cords is wonderful, and it significantly lowers the resistance to cleaning up small problems that you wouldn't touch if you had to drag the bigger machine out of the closet. It is light, easy to maneuver and cleans up well. We're going to give one to our daughter for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: wingman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little Vacuum! Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use like an electric broom, for quick cleanups. But it is so much more, easy to handle fits right in my coat closet and charge holds for a long time. It is so powerful for a little vacuum. Also fits in small spaces and under couches. I can’t say enough about the vacuum I’d give it 10 stars if I could. I haven’t been this satisfied with a product in for very long time
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these. The first one I bought years ago is still working absolutely great. However, the last two I've bought get clogged easily and the very last one I bought the head will not stay down close to the floor and I have to constantly place my foot on it to make it stay. I will NOT buy another one. I do not understand why they mess with a good thing and the newer models are crappy!
customer_reviews.author: FD in AJ

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is great- picks up my dog hair and other dirt with ease. This is my second one, and although I think the vacuum itself is even better than my first (7 yrs old) the battery charger doesn’t work right. When you remove the charged battery it just keeps slowly flashing, and the only way to re-set it it to unplug it and then plug in again. Aggravating but I work around it. Otherwise it’s a great value for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: camoe

customer_reviews.title: Was impressed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to dislike this vacuum so I could get a more expensive one with all sorts of bells and whistles i really didnt need. But it is great and I'm gonna keep it. It worked great for our hardwood floors and rugs. Picked up so much in the corners and high traffic areas. Great suction and battery life. It was so lightweight, I may never lug the big vacuum downstairs again!
customer_reviews.author: C. Neukirch

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for picking up kitty litter crumbs and since we ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the Hoover Stick Linx Cordless vac. It is perfect for picking up kitty litter crumbs and since we have a long haired white cat it picks up clumps of fur on the rugs and wood floors. Easy to empty the canister when finished. It is perfect for quick cleanups. The battery charge does not let me do the the whole first floor, but I have an electric vacuum for the big jobs. I use the Hoover Linx for fast, quick, spot jobs, usually 5 times a week, and the charge will last me for all those.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a dime
customer_reviews.text: Have dark hardwood floors.... just swept and there is still a lot left to pick up... the sweeper picks up and then drops whatever it picked up. Forget about getting half of a dried leaf that came in in someone’s foot. This sweeper won’t get it. Battery needs to recharged after approx 20 minutes of use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gangof5

customer_reviews.title: Works well but breaks VERY easily!
customer_reviews.text: Used to love this vacuum. I’ve bought three of them. They’re not built like they used to be and break very easily. The two break points are the connection of the handle to the vacuum and also the connection of the vacuum head to the vacuum. Investing in a dyson going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kobrinsky

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction on carpets
customer_reviews.text: Only good for bare floors! Why spend so much money on a vacuum that barely picks up anything on a low pile rug. Suction poor. Used this product while in a condo rental which had bare floors and some rugs. Worked well so decided to buy. Vacuumed two bedrooms and a bathroom which resulted in a dirt cup with a minuscule amount of dirt. Back it goes. Only liked that it was cordless. The search is on.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie C

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it says it is
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog which sheds. This kinda sorta picks up the dog hair but not very well. The brush head doesn't seem strong enough to wisk it into the vacuum - and the suction isn't the best to get all the hair up especially on rugs. Would not buy this again. Also the battery doesn't seem to last as long as they say when you run the brush head most of the time. Maybe 35-40 min at best on full battery.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Cordless, powerful, handy and efficient!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little vacuum for hard wood floors, tile and rugs. It was easy to assemble and easily stored. It has a lot of power and it’s cordless. Once charged, it does a great job! I love it!! It has a hard wood setting and a setting for rugs. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We have looked long for a new cordless. Most if not all were too costly. One of our g-daughters had started an on-line site that recommended vacuums and that site brought this cordless vac to our attention (well rated by CU). We bought one, and it works well. We will buy another for another use. Very satisfied. Battery removes to charge, reasonably quickly; charge lasts; vacuum gets up hair from 3 cats; does floors and carpets....
customer_reviews.author: Dan Upper Marlboro

customer_reviews.title: Small part that holds head onto post broke in less than10 months & can't be purchased separately
customer_reviews.text: The 'Nozzle-release button" broke on the vacuum within 1 year of purchase but it does not appear to have any product support after 6-months! Poor product support. We live on a planet of finite resources and I am extremely bothered when products are not designed to last. And, the tiny broken part--in the photo--cannot be purchased separately so the vacuum can't be repaired. The best available option is purchase of an entire new vacuum head unit which is $80! Shame on you, Hoover!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Sweeper for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this sweeper. I bought one years ago and loved it until it finally died...just bought another. It is great on hard wood floors and kitchen floors...so light weight, great suction power, and you can not beat the price. If you are looking for a sweeper to get up those dust bunnies, and dog hair and small items...this is IT!!! S. Barger
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a lightweight, cordless vaccuum to do quick cleanups of our wood floors. Crumbs in the kitchen, kitty litter in the laundry room/bath rooms and cat hair from the carpet. It's been working great for all of these. The battery lasts long enough to vacuum the entire downstairs of wood flooring. Battery charges pretty quick. Easy to dump the cannister.
customer_reviews.author: GlennMS

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! Very light, very maneuverable, and seems to clean pretty darn good. Charge seems to last about 20 minutes. I did most of or 1800 sq ft vacation house with wood floors and lots of rugs (some VERY think ... shag ... and did an excellent job. Makes what used to be fairly hard job much easier. We likes it so much, both one for our regular house.
customer_reviews.author: dmvrlv

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cordless vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Linx vacuum - replaceable batteries are a great idea and the vacuum really does the job on hardwood surfaces and carpet. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Chris Riggins

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lightweight vacuum! It has a hard time getting into corners but that’s not really what it’s designed for. It does a pretty good job on floors. We have animals so I still deep clean on occasion but this vacuum is a great help daily. I leave it out in the front porch room so I can quickly spot clean. I’m planning on getting another that I can keep upstairs near the bedrooms. The battery really holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Not for older family members. Otherwise Great.
customer_reviews.text: First off this is an impressive vacuumn but I bought this for my grandmother who is moving into a retirement village. The problem is she can’t get the battery out to charge it on her own. She’s 92 and is in better health than me but it’s just very difficult to remove the battery for even me. If you’re older and struggle with things like this I don’t recommend it. If you’re younger and can handle it then I’m inpressed with this unit. I do wish it had a 2in1 hand vac but I knew that before I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love love love this power house vacuum! So fast and easy to use on my hardwood floors. I couldn't believe the suction power and what it picked up! We burn wood in the living room, so I'm always dealing with wood chips. This little sweeper sucked those chips up with no problem. It also sucked up a Kleenex and didn't get clogged up. I swept over 800 sq feet in less than 10 minutes. I'm not sure how long the battery lasts, but I'm ordering an extra one today, so charging won't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Timm

customer_reviews.title: Don't like it
customer_reviews.text: This doesnt work. It leaves dirt and hair behind and in one light use it clogged and was difficult to free. It is weak and low quality. I bought it to keep my kitchen tidy and Im back to using my broom. If i felt like messing with it i may be able to get better performance but I'm too frustrated with it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Mercier

customer_reviews.title: Efficient with ample power
customer_reviews.text: After owning two earlier model Linx vacuums with cords, I purchased the cordless model. It is very handy and I love not having to worry about tripping or knocking something over with the cord. I have pergo floors and area rugs, so this has sufficient power for the job. The lithium battery needs to be charged almost after every use, which surprised me. Still, I am very happy with the purchase and look forward to several years use.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. E

customer_reviews.title: my new broom!
customer_reviews.text: I am blind. I do not get along well with a broom and dustpan. I was terribly amused when meeting another blind person once and when he discovered I was the Mama of three young children his first question to me was....How do you sweep? My answer then was..."I don't." I tended to let things get a bit cruddy and then haul out my central vac and clean it up. No more. I love this little machine and it is so light and easy to use that even my 4yo daughter will cheerfully clean up a cereal spill etc.
customer_reviews.author: Shenweas

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick clean up and cat hair!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product so far. I have been only using for about a month, but it does great on hard floor and carpet. Also great for picking up cat hair and suction is very good. I have a small one bed condo and this is ideal for my area. I don't think you would want to use this as your only option with a house of any size, but even then good for a quick pickup. I have friends using this item for a few years now and they are happy with this product too. That is why I decided to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great battery sweeper!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this Hoover unit over the past few years because I sweep everyday. You dont have to get right next to the shoe mold to get dirt and dust. This is a great battery sweeper!!! When I wear one out..I buy another. This unit appeared the same as the Hoover battery unit for more money. Same product a few upgrades that dont change the products usage.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless stick vac!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little vacuum. It’s impressive how it picks up cat litter, hair and dust bunnies. I can almost do the whole main floor with a single charge of the battery. I do wish the battery lasted a little longer. I have all hardwood floors, so it’s great that I can turn the roller brush off. I highly recommend the Hoover Signature Linx cordless vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight easily portable cordless Vaccuum
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small vacuum. You can whip it out after a meal and have your kitchen spotless in a minute. Lovely to not wrestle with cords! Not as powerful as my big vacuum but o use it daily for entry hallway kitchen and it’s super easy to vacuum the stairs with it. Lightweight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: a satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a week and it’s never worked for me. Runs for maybe 7 seconds then shuts off. I followed all the directions with battery charging, it just won’t stay on. When I can get it to stay on it’s great. Unfortunately I bought this to save me time, but all I do is fight with it. Wouldn’t recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: tmj1

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum for my small apt! It is very lightweight and the suction is great! I wanted a cordless vac and one that will get under furniture and this hoover does it all! Battery stays charged for the time I need which is about 30 or 40 minutes and is very easy to recharge I am glad I bought this!!
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Gilchrist

product_meta.title: Hoover BH50020PC Linx Signature Stick Cordless Vacuum Cleaner, Rechargeable Lithium Ion Battery, Lightweight, Black
product_meta.description: Retire your dustpan and broom and transform your everyday floor cleaning! This sleek, versatile stick vacuum is always ready to deliver upright performance with Fade Free Lithium-Ion battery power. LiNX Signature has powerful performance on all floor types without the hassle of a cord.
feature_bullets: Lightweight: At 10 pounds this vacuum cleaner is easy to clean effortlessly
Multi floor cleaning: Easily transition from carpet to hardwood floors
Windtunnel technology: Creates channels of suction to lift and remove surface debris and deeply embedded dirt
Low profile design: Lies flat to reach under hard to clean furniture

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,552 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
